intro: Notholaena vellea, commonly known as the velvet fern, is a perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a soft, velvety appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Notholaena vellea is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its unique, mat-forming growth habit.
